components.description: A video game emoji, shown on major platforms as a console gamepad with D-pad, joysticks, and buttons.
components.title: Video Game

description: A video game emoji, shown on major platforms as a console gamepad with D-pad, joysticks, and buttons.
title: Video Game

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Game symbol

emoji_net_data.name: video game

bn:00091708v: To perform in (a sport); to participate in (a game).
To take part in a sport's match.

bn:01060449n: A "gamer" is someone who partakes in interactive gaming, such as video games or board games.
A player of one or more video games.
A person who plays video games.

bn:00021477n: This is a collection of quotes about video games. games
An electronic game, especially a game played using a general purpose computer (as opposed to a game console).
A video game played on a personal computer
A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.
One of the player's chances to play, lost when a mistake is made.

A type of game existing as and controlled by software, usually run by a video game console or a computer, and played on a video terminal or television screen. Controlled by a paddle, joystick, joypad, mouse, keyboard, or a combination of any of them.
PC games, also known as computer games, are video games played on a general-purpose personal computer rather than a dedicated video game console or arcade machine.
A game played against a computer
One of the player's chances to play, lost when a mistake is made (e.g. in a video game).
The activity of playing video or computer games

A class of computer program in which one or more users interact with the computer as a form of entertainment. Computer games run the gamut from simple alphabet games for toddlers to chess, treasure hunts, war games, and simulations of world events. The games are controlled from a keyboard or with a joystick or other device and are supplied on disks, on CD-ROMs, as game cartridges, on the Internet, or as arcade devices.
A game that involves interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device, most commonly a television or monitor.

bn:00162382n: A game controller is a device used with games or entertainment systems to provide input to a video game, typically to control an object or character in the game.
An input device used for playing video games
Device used with games or entertainment systems
A device used to control a video game. For example, a joystick, mouse, or gamepad.

bn:02617074n: A dedicated electronic device that is designed to play video games, especially in accompaniment with a television.
A computer or other electronic device designed for playing video games.
Interactive entertainment computer or customized computer system to display a video game
A video game console is a device that outputs a video signal or visual image to display a video game.
An interactive entertainment computer or electronic device that manipulates the video display signal of a display device (a television, monitor, etc.) to display a game.
The keyboard and screen of a computer or other electronic device.
A specific device for playing video games

bn:15625318n: An eighth generation video game console by Sony.
Fourth home video game console produced by Sony Computer Entertainment
The PlayStation 4 is a home video game console from Sony Computer Entertainment.

bn:00037180n: An activity described by a set of rules, especially for the purpose of entertainment, often competitive or having an explicit goal.

A class of computer program in which one or more users interact with the computer as a form of entertainment. Computer games run the gamut from simple alphabet games for toddlers to chess, treasure hunts, war games, and simulations of world events. The games are controlled from a keyboard or with a joystick or other device and are supplied on disks, on CD-ROMs, as game cartridges, on the Internet, or as arcade devices.
Games are activities involving structured playing, usually undertaken for enjoyment and sometimes used as an educational tool.
A pursuit or activity with rules performed either alone or with others, for the purpose of entertainment.
A contest with rules to determine a winner
A game is structured playing, usually undertaken for enjoyment and sometimes used as an educational tool.

bn:01726821n: A video game console of the "PlayStation" brand.

bn:00537969n: Series of video game consoles created and developed by Sony Computer Entertainment
A series of video game consoles developed by Sony Computer Entertainment
PlayStation is a series of video game consoles created and developed by Sony Computer Entertainment.

bn:00982198n: Video gaming brand created by Microsoft
Xbox is a video gaming brand created and owned by Microsoft.
